title: DEAR MAN: Assert Your Needs
summary: A step-by-step formula for asking for what you want, saying no, or negotiating, while staying effective and clear.

details.content: Many people struggle to express their needs directly, leading to resentment, misunderstanding, or not getting what they want.
Instead of hinting, you calmly say, 'I would like you to call if you’ll be late,' using DEAR MAN skills to get your point across.

content: D - Describe the situation objectively.
E - Express how you feel or what you believe.
A - Assert what you want or need clearly.
R - Reinforce by explaining benefits.
M - (Stay) Mindful of your goals.
A - Appear confident (body language, tone).
N - Negotiate if needed; be willing to give to get.

title: GIVE: Keep Relationships Positive
summary: Skills to maintain and strengthen important relationships while making requests or resolving conflict.

details.content: Relationships can be damaged by criticism or defensiveness. GIVE skills help you stay connected even when discussing tough topics.
You need to talk to a friend about something they did that upset you, but you use GIVE skills to stay gentle and validating.

content: G - Be Gentle: Avoid attacks, threats, or judging.
I - Act Interested: Listen and show attention.
V - Validate: Acknowledge the other person's feelings and viewpoint.
E - Use an Easy manner: Smile, joke, or be light when appropriate.

title: FAST: Maintain Self-Respect
summary: Communicate assertively while keeping your self-respect and values intact, even if it means disappointing others.

details.content: Sometimes, getting what you want comes at the cost of self-respect. FAST helps you stay true to yourself, especially when pressured.
You turn down a request for a favor you can’t do, and you do it firmly but respectfully, not giving in to guilt or pressure.

content: F - Be Fair: To yourself and the other person.
A - No Apologies: Don’t over-apologize for having needs or opinions.
S - Stick to your values: Don’t compromise your principles.
T - Be Truthful: Don’t exaggerate or make excuses.

title: Balancing Priorities and Demands
summary: Skills for knowing when to prioritize your needs, when to compromise, and when to let go in relationships and responsibilities.

details.content: Trying to do everything for everyone often leads to burnout, resentment, and ineffective action.
You decide not to work late, even though your boss hints, because you need time for family and self-care.

content: List your top values and responsibilities.
Weigh the urgency and importance of each demand.
Communicate limits clearly to others.
Remember it’s okay to delegate or decline sometimes.

title: Saying No Effectively
summary: Learn to decline requests, set limits, and protect your time and energy—without unnecessary guilt.

details.content: Saying yes to everything can lead to overwhelm and resentment. Saying no clearly and respectfully preserves relationships and well-being.
When asked to take on extra work, you politely decline, stating you’re already at capacity, instead of reluctantly agreeing.

content: Be clear and concise; you don’t owe lengthy explanations.
Use a confident tone and body language.
Practice ‘no’ in small, low-stakes situations.
Acknowledge the other person’s feelings, but stand firm.
